The combined market valuation of six of the 10 most valued Indian companies declined by Rs 34,182.7 crore last week, with information technology major Tata Consultancy Services Ltd. taking the steepest hit.From the top-10 list, TCS, HDFC Ltd., Hindustan Unilever Ltd., Maruti Suzuki Ltd., Infosys Ltd. and Oil and Natural Gas Ltd. (ONGC) suffered losses in their market capitalisations for the week ended Friday, while Reliance Industries Ltd., HDFC Bank Ltd., ITC Ltd. and State Bank of India Ltd. made gains aggregating to Rs 30,204 crore.The market cap of TCS slumped reduced by Rs 22,226.42 crore to Rs 4.72 lakh crore, taking the biggest knock among the top-10 entities.Maruti Suzuki India's valuation tumbled by Rs 5,576.4 crore to Rs 2.19 lakh crore while that of ONGC tanked Rs 2,951.64 crore to Rs 2.14 lakh crore. The market cap of Infosys declined by Rs 1,872.01 crore to Rs 2.16 lakh crore while that of HUL dipped Rs 789.75 crore to Rs 2.36 lakh crore. The valuation of HDFC fell by Rs 766.51 crore to Rs 2.6 lakh crore.
















On the other hand, the capitalisation of RIL surged Rs 17,021.26 crore to reach Rs 4.51 lakh crore. SBI's valuation zoomed Rs 12,777.78 crore to Rs 2.46 lakh crore and that of HDFC Bank rose by Rs 282.57 crore to Rs 4.28 lakh crore. ITC added Rs 121.47 crore to its market cap to Rs 3.72 lakh crore.In the market capitalisation ranking of top-10 firms, TCS stood at number one position, followed by RIL, HDFC Bank, ITC, HDFC, SBI, HUL, Maruti, Infosys and ONGC.Both key indices BSE Sensex and Nifty50 registered their second straight weekly fall losing 205.66 points, or 0.65 percent, and 80.20 points, or 0.82 percent, respectively.
title: Six Of Top 10 Companies Lost Rs 34,183 Crore In Market Capitalisation Last Week
